etymologies: late 16th century. From classical Latin phōca seal from ancient Greek ϕώκη, of unknown origin

definitions: Originally: a seal. Later: any of several seals of the genus Phoca (family Phocidae), which includes the common or harbour seal. Now only (in form Phoca): the genus itself.

notes.text: Adopted as a genus name by Linnaeus in Systema Naturae (1735). Valid publication: Linnaeus Systema Naturae (ed. 10, 1758) I. 37.
